byline.contributor: Joseph Goldstein reported from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan. Mujib Mashal contributed reporting from Faryab, Afghanistan; Matthew Rosenberg from Washington; and Ismail Khan from Peshawar, Pakistan.
byline.original: By JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN and TAIMOOR SHAH

abstract: Death of Taliban leader Mullah Muhammad Omar raises difficult questions for the insurgency, including whether anyone has enough support to keep it from splintering irrevocably.
lead_paragraph: The death of its leader raises difficult questions for the group, including whether anyone has enough support to keep it from splintering irrevocably.

headline.main: Death of Mullah Omar Exposes Divisions Within Taliban
headline.print_headline: Death of Leader Exposes Festering Divisions Within the Taliban

snippet: The death of its leader raises difficult questions for the group, including whether anyone has enough support to keep it from splintering irrevocably.
